metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4498 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The add-on installation feature in Mozilla Firefox before 40.0.3 andFirefox ESR 38.x before 38.2.1 allows remote attackers to bypass anintended user-confirmation requirement by constructing a crafted data: URLand triggering navigation to an arbitrary http: or https: URL at a certainearly point in the installation process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 40.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
